info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Union, northwestern Pulaski and northwestern Alexander Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 438 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Ware, or 10 miles southeast of Trail Of Tears State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tamms around 450 PM CDT. Jonesboro around 455 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Anna and Dongola. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 12 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southern Illinois...western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
